ygData.msgSnippet: I m not sure how familiar people are with this domain. I picked up on it last year from a post on the Genetic Programming yahoo group, it s basically 6 inputs,

Subject: 6-Multiplexer Problem Domain - Success!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=127853030
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod

I'm not sure how familiar people are with this domain. I picked up on it 
last year from a post on the Genetic Programming yahoo group, it's 
basically 6 inputs, made up of two binary address inputs which select 
which of four binary data inputs should be returned as a response.

Anyway, after taking a fresh look at the code today I spotted an error 
and also made a small change to the fitness function. SharpNEAT has just 
found a perfect network in two independent runs, taking about 10-15 mins 
each. I wonder how this compares to GP's ability to find a solution? I 
would guess probably not too well actually, since I would guess that GP 
is better suited to boolean logic type problems. I may investigate this.

I think this domain was also related to the image processing that John 
Arrowood was working on. I think that the switching ability was a 
sub-task of what John was trying to achieve.

I'm going to try the more difficult 11-multiplexer now, that's 3 address 
lines and 8 data lines.

Colin.
